name: madnes
text:
I purchased some Craisins as a result of this strip

(I live in Australia where such a thing is a rare occurrance)

name: saurkraus
text: You know what else is a rare occurence in this country? Decent hot sauce.

name: zapatos
text: Get you some o' Ray's Rad Chilis!

name: courtland
text: Speaking of Craisins, this is a food that I would have thought Pat to be all over.

name: mattylite
text: Me too.  What the hell, old Pat?

name: dusty
text: maybe some day it will flash back to the traumatic personal event that made him start being a dick. Perhaps being attracted to women was a big part of his charm and the gay curse embittered him deeply.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Craisins are nasty and vegan; Pat should love them! In fact, he should sneak them into his sprouted spelt & flax seed "bestitute" waffles

name: gambolholic
text: I agree, I'm sure Pat had a change of heart when he developed a personality.

name: gunsofray
text: and a shirt and new hair, after the rock hard cat cock Mexican Realism incident.. Does this mean Pat has perhaps changed the most out of all the characters, during the course of Achewood?

name: farqussus
text: Craisins are vegan? What's not vegan about raisins? Is craisin just short for 'crap raisin'?

name: howl
text: They are vegan in the technical sense of the word, but they also fufill the requirements for Pat's brand of "asshole veganism:" they are ostentatiously nasty and something you would only eat if there was no regular-food alternative.

name: purplehaze
text: Man, they are delicious. They're like raisins, but you don't feel depressed after eating them.

name: tekende
text: Raisins do not depress me, Mr. Manson. I don't know what you're talking about.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Mr. Manson is depressed by eating anything wholesome, Mr. Bateman.

name: zapatos
text: They are amazing, I eat them.

name: akarroa
text: Short for 'cranberry raisin'

name: deancain29
text: I see Ray being played by a sleazy Russell Crowe.

name: satellitetv
text: Colin Farell

name: tekende
text: No to both.

name: history
text: Michael Madsen or perhaps Tom Sizemore

name: morganization
text: craisins win me over on this one

name: moe_hawkins
text: Dude ! There completely IS a broad at that party ! Quite a sexy lady-bear-broad at that ! I'm really feeling her glasses (they feel like frozen velvet).

name: tinhand
text:
Whatever happened to this broad?

Also; Pat just seemed to be a regular guy in the early strips, not much personality developed. I don't even think I noticed the transition between regular guy and complete asshole.

name: lastlarf
text: Also Roast Beef smokes almost constantly in these early strips...

name: fosters
text: You can see a little bit of early Pat personality when Ray calls him for help on his missing thong and Pat won't even answer the phone until Ray offends him.

name: spinynorman
text:
I have occasionally been to parties where there was a broad/broads

It feels like having a balloon inflated in your chest and the balloon is filled with gold dust

name: woodenteeth
text: ... and when you talk to them the balloon bursts and the dust comes out your nose and mouth and a bit goes into her drink and she turns away kinda disgusted but impressed. You're like some kind of drunk magician.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
it saves money on:

[IMGS OFF]

name: cicadalek
text: Note that Cornelius is already impressing the broad with his children's books before the the other fellows have even noticed her. OLD SCHOOL

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "pushing the cart, the cart of dusty excuses"

name: nutmeg
text: you know what man? i appreciate you.

name: rowboat
text: Does anyone else not understand this alt text? It must mean something, but it's completely over my head. Tell me.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: It's because back when those comments were made, you could only see the alt-text by reading the comics on the main page, not here ("Acheworld" as it was called then).

name: nutmeg
text:
he was trying to analyze the text, not asking why it was repeated as a comment.

and to that end, i have no answer.

name: rowboat
text: Thanks anyway.

name: philosophe
text: Why are lines coming off of Todd's head in panel 2?

name: gothfae
text: He's stinking drunk

name: joeyramoney
text: A comment left by joeyramoney was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, silver_lake, equinn2006, Lumus, tomsonlocal, luckypyjamas, lux, RedJoker, ANinasaurusRex)

name: equinn2006
text: Character development, man!

name: philosophe
text: It's kind of subtly funny if you understand the relationship between Ray and Pat.

name: lux
text: I wish I could lame you twice.

name: hypoluxa
text: "Daaamn!"

name: heyman
text: I love todd drinking on the ledge of the table, I imagine his little squirrel legs dangling off the side

name: luckypyjamas
text: pat looks like some kind of punk here

name: kelsotimebomb
text: No kidding... sleeveless shirt all open, showing off some chest hair.

name: catgrl131
text: Fur, man. Fur.

name: donnatron
text: It was the first time I saw this strip that I began to appreciate the art of READING Achewood. It requires a certain attention to character and detail.

name: ih8jonmayr
text: Am I the only person who noticed Todd?

name: doctorbeene
text: yes.

name: mattylite
text: Whoa, awesome.  Thank you.

name: doctorbeene
text: I doubt Pat is the one who's excited about the broad, only he doesn't know why yet.

name: history
text: I think Pat is slightly angry about there being a broad.  I think that's why he uses the word broad instead of such as lady or chick.
